alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cameron; Inland Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 05 at 1:55PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cameron and southeastern Willacy Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 154 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lozano, or near Laureles, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harlingen, San Benito, La Feria, Los Fresnos, Santa Rosa, Rancho Viejo, Rio Hondo, Palm Valley, Rangerville, and Olmito. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 8 and 38. US Highway 281 between mile markers 824 and 832. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
